intro: Gouania cormorensis, commonly known as the Colombian goania, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Colombia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Gouania cormorensis is often found in moist, shaded habitats within mountainous areas.
